intro: Fadogia tomentosa var. flaviflora, commonly known as the golden-flowered stromboid, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
